MANcategory.Title: System
MANcategory.Body: A system call represents an entry to the linux Kernel.

MANdoc.Title: clone
MANdoc.Body: A function which creates a new child process from a given process.

MANdoc.Title: exit
MANdoc.Body: Asks the kernel to terminate the calling process.

MANcategory.Title: Directories
MANcategory.Body: A directory represents a node on the system's file tree.

MANdoc.Title: cd
MANdoc.Body: A command which changes a shell's current working directory to another address.

MANdoc.Title: ls
MANdoc.Body: A command which lists files in a unix shell's current directory.

MANdoc.Title: pwd
MANdoc.Body: Prints the path to the current directory.

MANcategory.Title: Files
MANcategory.Body: A file represents a structured collection of data.

MANdoc.Title: mv
MANdoc.Body: Renames a file to have another name.

MANdoc.Title: cp
MANdoc.Body: Makes a copy of a file to and gives it a specific name.

MANdoc.Title: rm
MANdoc.Body: Deletes a given filename if it is available.

MANdoc.Title: chmod
MANdoc.Body: A command which changes the permissions on a given file.
